commit_message:
devref: Cleanup OVS vHost User Guide

There are some formatting issues with this document. Fix them.

Change-Id: I8fad16fb8dc11d87b1fc185be80046d1778d7b93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/53/315153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Platform requirements --------------------- * OVS 2.4.0+ * DPDK 2.0+ Configuration ------------- .. code-block:: ini [OVS] datapath_type=netdev vhostuser_socket_dir=/var/run/openvswitch When OVS is running with DPDK support enabled, and the ``datapath_type`` is set to ``netdev``, then the OVS ML2 driver will use the ``vhost-user`` VIF type and pass the necessary binding details to use OVS+DPDK and vhost-user sockets. This includes the ``vhostuser_socket_dir`` setting, which must match the directory passed to ``ovs-vswitchd`` on startup.also provides a devstack plugin which also allows automated CI, a Puppet
deleted_lines: Neutron+OVS+DPDK platform requirements -------------------------------------- OVS 2.4.0+ DPDK 2.0+ Neutron OVS+DPDK vhost-user config ---------------------------------- [OVS] datapath_type=netdev vhostuser_socket_dir=/var/run/openvswitch When OVS is running with DPDK support enabled, and the datapath_type is set to "netdev", then the OVS ML2 driver will use the vhost-user VIF type and pass the necessary binding details to use OVS+DPDK and vhost-user sockets. This includes the vhostuser_socket_dir setting, which must match the directory passed to ovs-vswitchd on startup.also provides a devstack plugin which also allows automated CI, a puppet

subject: Fixed help messages for path_mtu and global_physnet_mtus options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-30 11:49:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/024b4330fd8d2a5fbcf2f612b5ded05bc9c5eaa8', 'message': 'Fixed help messages for path_mtu and global_physnet_mtus options

For path_mtu, make it clear it applies to tunnel typed tenant networks.
Removed information about specific mechanisms used to advertise MTU
values to instances because a) it duplicates the global_physnet_mtu
option description; b) it is not complete now that we also advertise MTU
via RAs. Finally, removed description for calculation details because
they duplicate global_physnet_mtu description.

While at it, fixed help text for global_physnet_mtus option not to refer
to segment_mtu which was renamed into global_physnet_mtu lately.

Change-Id: Ib0010206f08ec9a76b0e26e84cdb03c80755908d
Related-Bug: #1566706

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-06-01 13:33:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/f45fc4c015f87196911066ce0fe1fa0dfa607747', 'message': "Fixed help messages for path_mtu and global_physnet_mtus options

For path_mtu, make it clear it applies to tunnel typed tenant networks.
Removed information about specific mechanisms used to advertise MTU
values to instances because a) it duplicates the global_physnet_mtu
option description; b) it is not complete now that we also advertise MTU
via RAs. Finally, removed description for calculation details because
they duplicate global_physnet_mtu description.

While at it, fixed help text for global_physnet_mtus option not to refer
to segment_mtu which was renamed into global_physnet_mtu lately.

The cherry-pick differs from the master patch, as Mitaka still uses
a default value of 1500 for segment_mtu. Master uses 0. The effect is,
that with Mitaka you have to override the default 1500 segment_mtu
value to use jumbo frames, while with master the default 0 value is
being ignored. There it's sufficient to specify the global_physnet_mtu
only.

Change-Id: Ib0010206f08ec9a76b0e26e84cdb03c80755908d
Related-Bug: #1566706
(cherry picked from commit 403e5a07f51dee1efd335011cdd6b4454d1e7fde)

For path_mtu, make it clear it applies to tunnel typed tenant networks.
Removed information about specific mechanisms used to advertise MTU
values to instances because a) it duplicates the global_physnet_mtu
option description; b) it is not complete now that we also advertise MTU
via RAs. Finally, removed description for calculation details because
they duplicate global_physnet_mtu description.

While at it, fixed help text for global_physnet_mtus option not to refer
to segment_mtu which was renamed into global_physnet_mtu lately.

The cherry-pick differs from the master patch, as Mitaka still uses
a default value of 1500 for path_mtu. Master uses 0. The effect is,
that with Mitaka you have to override the default 1500 path_mtu
value to use jumbo frames, while with master the default 0 value is
being ignored. There it's sufficient to specify the global_physnet_mtu
only.

Change-Id: Ib0010206f08ec9a76b0e26e84cdb03c80755908d
Related-Bug: #1566706
(cherry picked from commit 403e5a07f51dee1efd335011cdd6b4454d1e7fde)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed help messages for path_mtu and global_physnet_mtus options

For path_mtu, make it clear it applies to tunnel typed tenant networks.
Removed information about specific mechanisms used to advertise MTU
values to instances because a) it duplicates the global_physnet_mtu
option description; b) it is not complete now that we also advertise MTU
via RAs. Finally, removed description for calculation details because
they duplicate global_physnet_mtu description.

While at it, fixed help text for global_physnet_mtus option not to refer
to segment_mtu which was renamed into global_physnet_mtu lately.

The cherry-pick differs from the master patch, as Mitaka still uses
a default value of 1500 for path_mtu. Master uses 0. The effect is,
that with Mitaka you have to override the default 1500 path_mtu
value to use jumbo frames, while with master the default 0 value is
being ignored. There it's sufficient to specify the global_physnet_mtu
only.

Change-Id: Ib0010206f08ec9a76b0e26e84cdb03c80755908d
Related-Bug: #1566706
(cherry picked from commit 403e5a07f51dee1efd335011cdd6b4454d1e7fde)

Without this update handlers that modified the body as they processed

commit_message:
Make deepcopy of update body in API layer

This adjusts the update handler in the API layer to pass a deepcopy
of the original update body to ensure that the original is used on
any generated retry requests.

Without this update handlers that modified the body as they processed
it (e.g. the external gateway update for routers) would be missing
data on a retry request.

This adds a test case for the bug that was caused by this.

Closes-Bug: #1584920
Change-Id: I88fb9d45eb82ef48e0d865decdcc7fad1c5fb361
(cherry picked from commit 5109d16bc52abb20636c94c0208fb498d1c626eb)

commit_message:
Remove redundant job suffix for rally jobs

Now we see at our gate:
  gate-rally-dsvm-magnum-rally-nv SUCCESS in Xm Ys (non-voting)
but as for me '-nv' job suffix name is redundant because we see
that job is non-voting inside the last brackets.

Change-Id: I1a88a7892bca67f4117bd42d07248c08585b1da9

commit_message:
PEP257: Ignore D203 because it was deprecated

PEP257's D203 check ensures that you have a blank line before class
docstrings. This rule directly conflicts with D211 (no blank lines
before class docstrings), which is intended to supersede D203.

The original language in PEP257 which D203 was based on was actually
removed from PEP257 by Guido here:

  https://hg.python.org/peps/rev/9b715d8246db

Change-Id: Icc048b947acea8f655d00540c221123b906e7545
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/07/325307/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Bump oslo.config to >=3.10.0

3.10.0 adds capability to generate multiple sample config files using
sphinxconfiggen extension. Glance needs this to be able to generate its
sample config files. Please see cd16e52be22aa203557b9a6be5c1b45977f690db

Change-Id: I8679a61fed0837667d7766704b5ccaee574729b9

subject: PEP257: Ignore D203 because it was deprecated
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-03 13:50:32.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware/commit/2387f9b05737355608a18ececddeea01201c79be', 'message': "PEP257: Ignore D203 because it was deprecated

PEP257's D203 check ensures that you have a blank line before class
docstrings. This rule directly conflicts with D211 (no blank lines
before class docstrings), which is intended to supersede D203.

The original language in PEP257 which D203 was based on was actually
removed from PEP257 by Guido here:

  https://hg.python.org/peps/rev/9b715d8246db

Change-Id: Icc048b947acea8f655d00540c221123b906e7545
"}]
commit_message:
PEP257: Ignore D203 because it was deprecated

PEP257's D203 check ensures that you have a blank line before class
docstrings. This rule directly conflicts with D211 (no blank lines
before class docstrings), which is intended to supersede D203.

The original language in PEP257 which D203 was based on was actually
removed from PEP257 by Guido here:

  https://hg.python.org/peps/rev/9b715d8246db

Change-Id: Icc048b947acea8f655d00540c221123b906e7545
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/06/325306/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # D203: 1 blank line required before class docstring (deprecated in pep257) ignore = D100,D101,D102,D103,D104,D203

commit_message:
Use JQuery promise/deferred objects to track AJAX

The JQuery library offers objects known as deferred for tracking
multiple call backs, this can be used with AJAX to track cases when we
only want to do something once multiple requests are complete such as
re-calling the datatables update method.

This also allows for us to track the completed state of a request in the
ajax queue without injecting a custom completed callback into every
request that is handled by the queue.

Change-Id: I7d5acb6d05a5822b2de7d73678797166276ac599
Closes-Bug: 1442146

commit_message:
Fix the py34 jenkins job

The oslo.messaging<5.2.0(the v5.2.0 update change is in review[1])
depends on amqp>=1.4.0, in amqp-2.0 and amqp2.0.1, there is an issue[2]
that lead the amqp cannot be correctly installed in py34
environment(the depent package vine-1.1.0 of amqp won't bee installed),
that has borken the ceilometer py34 job[3]. we can wait the change[1]
merged and then bump the oslo.message version to avoid this issue. Because
Ceilometer don't participate the global-requirements, so we bump the
oslo.messaging to 5.2.0.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324023/
[2] https://github.com/celery/py-amqp/issues/91
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/41/323641/4/check/gate-ceilometer-python34/cf3f043/console.html

Change-Id: Icb34a7f0e03662868aa0ce6e060c5e951711b79e

commit_message:
Fix role restriction iteration cycle according to docs

Role restrictions could be defined in full or short format

restrictions:
  - condition: "settings:other_plugin == null or settings:other_plugin.metadata.enabled != true"
    message: "Other plugin must be installed and enabled"
  - "settings:common.libvirt_type.value != 'kvm'": "KVM only is supported"
  - "settings:storage.volumes_ceph.value == true"

This patch fixes restriction iteration cycle.

Change-Id: I6072ea9e92999ae7a94f28f42bb475b30bb7fff1
Closes-Bug: #1586334

commit_message:
Add service_token_off to keystone hash

Adding service_token_off to astute.yaml lets us reuse a
fuel-library single class to disable the keystone service
token.

Use pip constraints

Always use pip constraints to avoid the backward compatibility
issue due to the depending lib version changes.

Change-Id: I0cc7a7564ceec663de267963cd22d577ed53d600

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 13.1.3

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's and also updates
the appropriate python requirements pins.

The tempest SHA is set to c2c90574a78c7704f06e8fac279c4f1d11365993
in order to work around a mismatch between the tempest requirements
and the upper constraints for the paramiko python package.

Change-Id: Id2556dff54f153bd4f3018f95b9d6f77a016d541

commit_message:
Fix tempest tests that use SSL

A new version of gabbi, 1.21.0, is required for gnocchi to work
properly with live SSL tests. That version adds a require_ssl
arg to build_tests. These changes determine the correct value
for that, and set it.

Change-Id: If8e1b0ae7de5d01c3e29de639474bc893fd7eb37

subject: Fix mistral installation in devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-03 11:12:20.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/8e071482b4b91055fdd4e0b8ca699f63682c95ee', 'message': 'Fix mistral installation in devstack

After pip upgrading following error has occured during
mistral installation:
Invalid requirement, parse error at "'[-e]'"

I assume that this is because of extra '-e' flag that was passed
in mistral script and that is redundant ('-e' flag will be added
automatically in setup_develop function).

Change-Id: Ifed16935b045c723881a9da157a8759eea421c2c
(cherry picked from commit 2b517d8838e1ebfa1a4ea45c7c2d92ee2c1076c4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mistral installation in devstack

After pip upgrading following error has occured during
mistral installation:
Invalid requirement, parse error at "'[-e]'"

I assume that this is because of extra '-e' flag that was passed
in mistral script and that is redundant ('-e' flag will be added
automatically in setup_develop function).

Change-Id: Ifed16935b045c723881a9da157a8759eea421c2c
(cherry picked from commit 2b517d8838e1ebfa1a4ea45c7c2d92ee2c1076c4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/29/325229/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Handle ovs_socket_mem as list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-03 09:52:21.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/l23network/templates/openvswitch_default_Debian.erb', 'deployment/puppet/l23network/manifests/params.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/ee2b0d17fdfa19b26161ac28bcc46996f6fc1e23', 'message': "Handle ovs_socket_mem as list

Due to yaml dump/load incomsistency, string like '1,2,3,4' will be
dumped without quotes and loaded without commas. To fix it, socket
memory per NUMA will be passed as a list.

Change-Id: I579c43a0e8a391092f33a755e18b06ef8ed1a62e
Closes-Bug: #1587898
(cherry picked from commit a91ea7a30900714aabfb8249d2d5f5b9c2131243)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle ovs_socket_mem as list

Due to yaml dump/load incomsistency, string like '1,2,3,4' will be
dumped without quotes and loaded without commas. To fix it, socket
memory per NUMA will be passed as a list.

Change-Id: I579c43a0e8a391092f33a755e18b06ef8ed1a62e
Closes-Bug: #1587898
(cherry picked from commit a91ea7a30900714aabfb8249d2d5f5b9c2131243)

commit_message:
[config-ref] update description about iscsi_use_multipath

To add details about configuring IBM Storwize with multipath support.
This has been fixed at master and stable/mitaka branch already.

Change-Id: Ibbebde5e06ee9280580e0bad58166898f155ba72
Closes-Bug: #1564442
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/24/323824/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: multipath configured. Add <literal>iscsi_use_multipath = True</literal> in <literal>[libvirt]</literal> of <literal>/etc/nova/nova.conf</literal>. The configuration should be done at compute nodes (hosts using libvirt). </para>

commit_message:
BGP dynamic routing api documentation

This is for how to use the BGP dynamic routing API.

Change-Id: I235e2def28c307cd5b4ba10374674a166a953e3a
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-spinout
Partial-Bug: #156000
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing refs/changes/77/317277/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Neutron dynamic routing is basing on the BGP protocol. This feature would allow Neutron to advertise its own routes to an external router using BGP protocol. Using the REST API, the cloud administrator could define the BGP peers and setup the interact relationship to advertise routes in OpenStack. The reference implementaion will employ a dynamic routing agent (``bgp_dragent``). This agent will have direct connectivity with configured peers and it will be responsible to update the dynamic routes of some defined routers. Different BGP driver can leverage or discard the agent basing on their own design. New Entity --------- BGP Speaker *********** * ``id`` The uuid of bgp speaker * ``name`` The name of bgp speaker * ``local_as`` The local AS value, range from 1 to 65535 * ``ip_version`` The ip address version for bgp speaker. 4 by default * ``tenant_id`` The project id which the bgp speaker belongs to * ``peers`` The remote peer connection which supports BGP * ``networks`` The tenant networks connected to the BGP speaker * ``advertise_floating_ip_host_routes`` Whether to enable or disable the advertisement of floating ip host routes by the BGP speaker. True by default * ``advertise_tenant_networks`` Whether to enable or disable the advertisement of tenant network routes by the BGP speaker. True by default BGP Peer ******** * ``id`` The uuid of BGP peer * ``name`` The name of BGP peer * ``peer_ip`` The IP address of BGP peer * ``remote_as`` The remote AS value, range from 1 to 65535 * ``auth_type`` The authentication algorithm. Supported algorithms: none and md5, none by default * ``password`` The authentication password * ``tenant_id`` The project id which BGP peer belongs to BGP Dynamic Routing Agent ************************* * ``id`` The uuid of BGP dynamic routing agent * ``name`` The name of BGP dynamic routing agent * ``host`` The hostname hosted BGP dynamic routing agent Using API --------- List BGP Speaker **************** We want to see a list of BGP speakers that the admin can access to. We issue a ``GET`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-speakers`` to retrieve this list of available bgp speakers. Return code: 200 Response body: { "bgp_speakers":[ { "peers":[ ], "name":"bgp-speaker-1", "tenant_id":"34a6e17a48cf414ebc890367bf42266b", "local_as":1001, "advertise_tenant_networks":true, "networks":[ ], "ip_version":4, "advertise_floating_ip_host_routes":true, "id":"5e08db80-db77-4b5c-a56d-dbca0b284f2c" }, { "peers":[ ], "name":"bgp-speaker", "tenant_id":"34a6e17a48cf414ebc890367bf42266b", "local_as":1000, "advertise_tenant_networks":true, "networks":[ ], "ip_version":4, "advertise_floating_ip_host_routes":true, "id":"b759b2a1-27f4-4a6b-bb61-f2c9a22c9902" } ] } List BGP Speaker in More Detail ******************************* We want to see a more detailed list of available bgp speakers that the admin can access to. We issue a ``GET`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>`` to retrieve the detailed specified bgp speaker. Return code: 200 Response body: { "bgp_speaker":{ "peers":[ ], "name":"bgp-speaker", "tenant_id":"34a6e17a48cf414ebc890367bf42266b", "local_as":1000, "advertise_tenant_networks":true, "networks":[ ], "ip_version":4, "advertise_floating_ip_host_routes":true, "id":"b759b2a1-27f4-4a6b-bb61-f2c9a22c9902" } } Create BGP Speaker ****************** Issue a ``POST`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2/bgp-speakers`` with following JSON-encoded data to create a BGP speaker: { "bgp_speaker":{ "ip_version":4, "local_as":"1000", "name":"bgp-speaker" } } Return code: 201 Response body: { "bgp_speaker":{ "peers":[ ], "name":"bgp-speaker", "tenant_id":"34a6e17a48cf414ebc890367bf42266b", "local_as":1000, "advertise_tenant_networks":true, "networks":[ ], "ip_version":4, "advertise_floating_ip_host_routes":true, "id":"5e08db80-db77-4b5c-a56d-dbca0b284f2c" } } Delete BGP Speaker ****************** We issue the ``DELETE`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>`` to delete the bgp speaker that the admin can access to. Return code: 204 No reponse body Update BGP Speaker ****************** We issue the ``PUT`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>`` to update the bgp speaker that the admin can access to. The following attributes can be updated. * ``name`` The name of BGP peer * ``advertise_floating_ip_host_routes`` Whether to enable or disable the advertisement of floating ip host routes by the BGP speaker. True by default * ``advertise_tenant_networks`` Whether to enable or disable the advertisement of tenant network routes by the BGP speaker. True by default List BGP Peer ************* We want to see a list of BGP peers that the admin can access to. We issue a ``GET`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-peers`` to retrieve this list of available bgp peers. Return code: 200 Response body: { "bgp_peers":[ { "auth_type":"none", "remote_as":1001, "name":"bgp-peer", "tenant_id":"34a6e17a48cf414ebc890367bf42266b", "peer_ip":"10.0.0.3", "id":"a7193581-a31c-4ea5-8218-b3052758461f" } ] } List BGP Peer in More Detail **************************** We want to see a more detailed list of available bgp peers that the admin can access to. We issue a ``GET`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-peers/<bgp-peer-id>`` to retrieve the detailed specified BGP peers. Return code: 200 Reponse body: { "bgp_peer":{ "auth_type":"none", "remote_as":1001, "name":"bgp-peer", "tenant_id":"34a6e17a48cf414ebc890367bf42266b", "peer_ip":"10.0.0.3", "id":"a7193581-a31c-4ea5-8218-b3052758461f" } } Create BGP Peer *************** Issue a ``POST`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-peers`` with following JSON-encoded data to create a BGP peer: { "bgp_peer":{ "auth_type":"none", "remote_as":"1001", "name":"bgp-peer", "peer_ip":"10.0.0.3" } } Return code: 201 Response body: { "bgp_peer":{ "auth_type":"none", "remote_as":"1001", "name":"bgp-peer", "tenant_id":"34a6e17a48cf414ebc890367bf42266b", "peer_ip":"10.0.0.3", "id":"a7193581-a31c-4ea5-8218-b3052758461f" } } Delete BGP Peer *************** We issue the ``DELETE`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2/bgp-peers/<bgp-peer-id>`` to delete the bgp peer that the admin can access to. Return code: 204 No response body Update BGP Peer **************** We issue the ``PUT`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2/bgp-peers/<bgp-peer-id>`` to update the bgp peer that the admin can access to. The following attributes can be updated. * ``name`` The name of BGP peer * ``password`` The authentication password Create Connection between BGP Speaker and BGP Peer ************************************************** Issue a ``PUT`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>/add-bgp-peers`` to bind the BGP peer to the specified BGP speaker with following JSON-encoded data: { "bgp_peer_id":"a7193581-a31c-4ea5-8218-b3052758461f" } Return code: 200 Response body: { "bgp_peer_id":"a7193581-a31c-4ea5-8218-b3052758461f" } Delete Connection between BGP Speaker and BGP Peer ************************************************** Issue a ``DELETE`` request with following data to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>/remove-bgp-peers`` to unbind the BGP peer: { "bgp_peer_id":"a7193581-a31c-4ea5-8218-b3052758461f" } Return code: 200 No response body Add Network to BGP Speaker ************************** Issue a ``PUT`` request with following data to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>/add_gateway_network`` to add a network to the specified BGP speaker: { "network_id":"f2269b61-6755-4174-8f64-5e318617b204" } Return code: 200 Response body: { "network_id":"f2269b61-6755-4174-8f64-5e318617b204" } Delete Network to BGP Speaker ***************************** Issue a ``DELETE`` request with following data to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>/remove_gateway_network`` to delete a network to the specified BGP speaker. Return code: 200 No response body List advertise routes in BGP Speaker ************************************ Issue the ``GET`` request to ```http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>/get_advertised_routes`` to list all routes advertised by the specified BGP speaker. Return code: 200 Response body: { "advertised_routes":[ { "cidr":"192.168.10.0/24", "nexthop":"10.0.0.1" } ] } List BGP speakers on Specified Dynamic Routing Agents ***************************************************** Issue a ``GET`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2.0/agents/<bgp-dragent-id>/bgp-drinstances`` to list all BGP speakers hosted on the specified dynamic routing agent. Return code: 200 Response body: { "bgp_speakers":[ { "peers":[ ], "name":"bgp-speaker", "tenant_id":"34a6e17a48cf414ebc890367bf42266b", "local_as":1000, "advertise_tenant_networks":true, "networks":[ ], "ip_version":4, "advertise_floating_ip_host_routes":true, "id":"b759b2a1-27f4-4a6b-bb61-f2c9a22c9902" } ] } List Dynamic Routing Agents Hosting the BGP speaker *************************************************** Issue a ``GET`` request to ``http://bgp.exmaple.com/v2.0/bgp-speakers/<bgp-speaker-id>/bgp-dragents`` to list all BGP dynamic routers which are hosting the specified BGP speaker. Return code: 200 Response body: { "agents":[ { "binary":"neutron-bgp-dragent", "description":null, "admin_state_up":true, "heartbeat_timestamp":"2016-05-17 03:05:12", "availability_zone":null, "alive":true, "topic":"bgp_dragent", "host":"yangyubj-virtual-machine", "agent_type":"BGP dynamic routing agent", "resource_versions":{ }, "created_at":"2016-05-09 07:38:00", "started_at":"2016-05-11 09:06:13", "id":"af216618-29d3-4ee7-acab-725bdc90e614", "configurations":{ "advertise_routes":0, "bgp_peers":0, "bgp_speakers":1 } } ] } Add BGP Speaker to Dynamic Routing Agent **************************************** Issue a ``POST`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2/agents/<bgp-agent-id>/bgp-drinstances`` to add a BGP speaker to a specified BGP dynamic routing agent. The following is the request body: { "bgp_speaker_id": "5639072c-49eb-480a-9f11-953386589bc8" } Return code: 201 No response body Delete BGP Speaker from Dynamic Routing Agent ********************************************* Issue a ``DELETE`` request to ``http://bgp.example.com/v2/agents/<bgp-agent-id>/bgp-drinstances/<bgp-speaker-id>`` to delete the BGP speaker on a specified BGP dynamic routing agent. Return code: 204 No response body Reference ---------

commit_message:
Versioned notification for keypairs

Currently, no useful notification will be sent
for keypair state change.
This spec will transform legacy notification
to versioned notification about keypairs,
and at the same time extend contents of
notification with extra data.

Blueprint: keypair-notification
Change-Id: I05080afb8bd4249f8bea23512b25844fecbefeb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/42/300942/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================ Improve notification for keypair ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/keypair-notification Currently, no useful notification will be sent for keypair state change. Nova notifies only key_name when creating/deleting keypair. So it is impossible for users to search keypair information (e.g. ssh public key) by using external system like searchlight. Problem description =================== Use Cases --------- The external system wants to index the keypairs which makes the query for large number of keypairs more fast and efficient. Some users and systems want to search and retrieve ssh public keys and fingerprints to cooperate with external systems by ssh passthrough. Proposed change =============== Versioned notifications will be added for the following actions: * keypair.create.start * keypair.create.end * keypair.delete.start * keypair.delete.end * keypair.import.start * keypair.import.end Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- No database schema change is needed. The following new objects will be added to keypair: .. code-block:: python @base.NovaObjectRegistry.register class KeypairNotification(notification.NotificationBase): # Version 1.0: Initial version VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'payload': fields.ObjectField('KeypairPayload') } @base.NovaObjectRegistry.register class KeypairPayload(notification.NotificationPayloadBase): # Version 1.0: Initial version SCHEMA = { 'id': ('keypair', 'id'), 'key_name': ('keypair', 'key_name'), 'key_type': ('keypair', 'key_type'), 'fingerprint': ('keypair', 'fingerprint'), 'public_key': ('keypair', 'public_key'), 'tenant_id': ('keypair', 'tenant_id'), 'user_id': ('keypair', 'user_id') } VERSION = '1.0' fields = { 'id': fields.IntegerField(), 'key_name': fields.StringField(), 'key_type': fields.StringField(), 'fingerprint': fields.StringField(), 'public_key': fields.StringField(), 'tenant_id': fields.UUIDField(), 'user_id': fields.UUIDField(), } def __init__(self, key_name): super(KeypairPayload, self).__init__() self.populate_schema(key_name=key_name) The definition of NotificationBase can be found [1]. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- Notification for keypair will be changed as follows: * 'Before'::: { "key_name": "key1", "tenant_id": "2a9db238db8f455fb2ec71da188c04c9", "user_id": "5ed98568284443b09b82f2a519a3f1d5" } * 'After'::: { "id": 1, "key_name": "key1", "key_type": "ssh", "fingerprint": "6d:a1:2c:a3:.....", "public_key": "Public key: ssh-rsa AAAAB3Nza......", "tenant_id": "2a9db238db8f455fb2ec71da188c04c9", "user_id": "5ed98568284443b09b82f2a519a3f1d5", "created_at": "2016-04-04T04:18:30.000000", "deleted_at": None } Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: h-eguchi Work Items ---------- * Delete a legacy notification of keypairs which have an unversioned payload. * Add a new notification of keypairs which have a versioned payload. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Besides unit test new functional test cases will be added to cover the improved notifications. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== [1]: Versioned notification: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/notifications.html#versioned-notifications History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Newton - Introduced

commit_message:
Align required args for 'fuel2 graph upload'

Dissallow 'fuel2 graph uplod' command execution without
required args (-e ENV | -r RELEASE | -p PLUGIN), e.g.:
  usage: fuel2 graph upload [-h]
         (-e ENV | -r RELEASE | -p PLUGIN) [-t TYPE] -f FILE

Change-Id: I4fb1215874a849ea032afadb9604fca0dc0784a1
Closes-Bug: 1587837

commit_message:
Update metrics spec to reflect review comments

This addresses a few small spec changes required for metrics as
determined in code review.

Including:
  * Updating who is working on the spec
  * Changing names of decorators and context managers to be more sane
  * Reflect that we're no longer using an external library for metrics.

Change-Id: I75cca69c97f10bafbdc8cf662836fb7502db6f39
Partial-Bug: #1526219

commit_message:
Implement propose_rdo_promote CI periodic job

Background: during a cycle, we deploy OpenStack on centos7 from trunk
using RDO repositories, automatically built at each commit in OpenStack.

Currently, Puppet OpenStack CI manually promotes
puppet-openstack-integration every week, to latest URL. We would like to
automate this process with a daily periodic job so every day we would
have a promotion and we could detect which commit in OpenStack would
break our CI, and we could work on it quicker than usual, because
feedback would be daily.

This patch adds a periodic job, called
"propose-puppet-openstack-rdo-promote" that will execute
jenkins/scripts/propose_rdo_promote.sh script. The script has been
tested and already used manually.

Change-Id: I9b19a440325f609746a197676d3799aa0f60ce66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/57/324557/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe # # Copyright (C) 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # Get latest RDO trunk consistent URL # DIR='puppet-openstack-integration' BASE_URL=https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-master CONSISTENT_URL=$BASE_URL/consistent/versions.csv ts=0 for current in $(curl -s $CONSISTENT_URL); do val=$(echo $current|cut -d, -f7) if [[ "$val" != 'Last Success Timestamp' ]] && [[ "$val" -gt "$ts" ]]; then ts=$val line=$current fi done if [ $ts = 0 ]; then echo "something went wrong aborting" 1>&2 exit 1 fi sha1=$(echo $line|cut -d, -f3) psha1=$(echo $line|cut -d, -f5|sed 's/\(........\).*/\1/') url=$BASE_URL/$(echo $sha1|sed 's/\(..\).*/\1/')/$(echo $sha1|sed 's/..\(..\).*/\1/')/${sha1}_${psha1}/ sed -i "s@\(.* => \)'http.*\(centos7\|delorean\).*',@\1'$url',@" $DIR/manifests/repos.pp # for debug cat $DIR/manifests/repos.pp

commit_message:
Add 'vip_namespace' optional argument for fuel2 VIP create command

Create operation for VIP accepts 'vip_namespace' as optional parameter.
Its processing was added to VIP client as it was missing in the original
patch for adding the commands to the client.

Change-Id: Ibeab8f4c51758d13141b217daff613d90a0f40dd
Related-Bug: #1576255

commit_message:
Use an image object, recorder object and status constants

Instead of using raw dicts and passing data around via
dictionaries (which makes it really hard to figure out
what is in those dictionaries at any point) prefer to
use objects. That way people can actually understand what
the object is supposed to be, vs guessing and/or having to
decipher its usage.

The same goes for raw string constants, prefer using
named constants instead.

Closes-Bug: #1586475

Change-Id: Ide179dc6593c50696d47a2d3d4cd000f343855d4

commit_message:
Remove pip_lock_down dependency

The pip_install and pip_lock_down roles have been merged.

Remove pip_lock_down from the role's meta dependencies and test
requirements.

commit_message:
Enable developer mode

This commit adds the ability to install magnum without a repo server.
This pattern is lifted from the os_cinder role and allows us to
further develop functional testing for this role.

Change-Id: Idcaad65b45c932613c739b2f498f8f92acbbf53b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary mock

In one of the unit tests, we unnecessarily mock os.path.join. This
seems to cause the test to hang on Python 3.4, as gettextutils will
hang when attempting to translate one of the messages logged by
the tested method.

For now, we'll just remove this mock as it's blocking the gate.
Still,We may have to understand better why we did not have this
issue before.

Change-Id: I00b0e1d2dd10a392096c35e81d402d5a4b0ef703

commit_message:
Add an enforce-ssl option

This patch adds an enforce-ssl option which when True
will redirect port 70 requests to port 443 to enforce
ssl connection.

Change-Id: Ibea1716261e9d221c71f88db6c22da83588420b0
Closes-Bug: 1221498

added_lines: enforce-ssl: type: boolean default: False description: | If True redirects plain http request to https port

commit_message:
Cache service providers on token validation

On fernet token validation we rebuild the entire token catalog. This includes
rebuilding the service providers references in the token if using a federated
token. In the mitaka release, patches were added to cache user catalogs and
role assignments. This allows us to do the same thing for service providers,
which decreases the time spent in get_token_data() by 34%.

Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>

Related-Bug: 1489061
Change-Id: I3dfe66880295ef36a18ca3e384191106b74be795

added_lines: def _register_model_handler(handler_class): """Registers a new model handler.""" _registry.frozen = False _registry.register(handler_class(registry=_registry)) _registry.frozen = True
deleted_lines: from keystone.models import revoke_model class _RevokeModelHandler(object): # NOTE(morganfainberg): There needs to be reserved "registry" entries set # in oslo_serialization for application-specific handlers. We picked 127 # here since it's waaaaaay far out before oslo_serialization will use it. identity = 127 handles = (revoke_model.RevokeTree,) def __init__(self, registry): self._registry = registry def serialize(self, obj): return msgpackutils.dumps(obj.revoke_map, registry=self._registry) def deserialize(self, data): revoke_map = msgpackutils.loads(data, registry=self._registry) revoke_tree = revoke_model.RevokeTree() revoke_tree.revoke_map = revoke_map return revoke_tree # Register our new handler._registry.frozen = False _registry.register(_RevokeModelHandler(registry=_registry)) _registry.frozen = True

commit_message:
Fix missing iptables in containers

On Ubuntu 16.04, iptables is not installed by default.

This patch ensures lxc hosts and containers have iptables
installed.

Change-Id: I31d367a840952c2e6a20730ce1ce1e049b44b419

commit_message:
Set side bar content to be configurable

Sometimes (e.g. for the api-ref pages) the TOC should be in the side bar.
This allows this to be set as a theme option, but defaulting to
current behaviour - the new TOC will only be set
if a project sets the "sidebar_mode" option to "toc".

Change-Id: I9b93b671d4c32f5b237b0d79ae2be39059402d72

commit_message:
Enable HAProxy consider MariaDB wsrep_local_state

This patch enable wsrep_notify_cmd to rename haproxy user in haproxy_blocked
when the node is not ready to serve and restore it when ready.

Change-Id: I4f49960d7ff2fa689d6ea730b2574f16f083edc1
Closes-Bug: 1578752
Closes-Bug: 1587752
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/00/322200/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # This script checks if a mysql igalera server is healthy running on localhost. # It will return: # "HTTP/1.x 200 OK" (if mysql is running smoothly) # - OR - # "HTTP/1.x 500 Internal Server Error" (else) # # The purpose of this script is make haproxy capable of monitoring mysql galera # properly # MYSQL_SOCK="/var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock" MYSQL_USERNAME="haproxy" MYSQL_OPTS="-N -q -A" TMP_FILE="/dev/shm/mysqlchk.$$.out" ERR_FILE="/dev/shm/mysqlchk.$$.err" FORCE_FAIL="/dev/shm/proxyoff" MYSQL_BIN="/usr/bin/mysql" CHECK_QUERY="SHOW GLOBAL STATUS WHERE variable_name='wsrep_local_state'" preflight_check() { for I in "$TMP_FILE" "$ERR_FILE"; do if [ -f "$I" ]; then if [ ! -w $I ]; then echo "HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable" echo "Content-Type: Content-Type: text/plain" echo echo "Cannot write to $I" echo exit 1 fi fi done } return_ok() { echo "HTTP/1.1 200 OK" echo "Content-Type: text/html" echo "Content-Length: 43" echo echo "<html><body>MySQL is running.</body></html>" echo rm $ERR_FILE $TMP_FILE exit 0 } return_fail() { echo "HTTP/1.1 503 Service Unavailable" echo "Content-Type: text/html" echo "Content-Length: 42" echo echo "<html><body>MySQL is *down*.</body></html>" echo rm $ERR_FILE $TMP_FILE exit 1 } preflight_check if [ -f "$FORCE_FAIL" ]; then echo "$FORCE_FAIL found" >$ERR_FILE return_fail fi $MYSQL_BIN $MYSQL_OPTS -S $MYSQL_SOCK -u $MYSQL_USERNAME -e "$CHECK_QUERY" >$TMP_FILE 2>$ERR_FILE || return_fail status=`cat $TMP_FILE | awk '{ print $2 }'` if [ $status -ne 4 ]; then return_fail fi return_ok

commit_message:
Hardening Nginx configuration

This commit contains some tweaks for the Nginx to prevent several
types of attacks, now we send to the client several HTTP headers
to enable client-side internal web browser protection mechanisms.
Also, we allow only required request methods for each service
provided by the server.

Change-Id: Idc60877c84f4b07617eaee0450fde4910e03f2e2
Closes-Bug: #1585203
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 264517e8784733acbd85253397cbddfb334614d6)

commit_message:
Lockdown pip when pip links are configured

The previous conditional was vague and overly tied
to the OSA inventory model. Deployers may want to lock down
pip to specific repositories that do not exist within
an OSA provided repository.

Alternatively, in a multi-region usage of OSA, the repository
may be a centralized service and therefore not present in
the dynamic inventory of a given region.

Change-Id: Ib5acd51435bd9432132c431d0b952bde41a6c890

commit_message:
Refactor revoke_model to remove circular dependency

In the process of caching service providers, a circular dependency was
uncovered between keystone's caching module and the revoke_model. This change
isolates the refactor to fix the circular dependency into it's own patch. A
separate follow on patch will add caching to service providers on token
creation and validation.

Change-Id: Iaa3c30d51270089b2d5999383d60ed0b2f7f56c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/33/325033/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _register_model_handler(handler_class): """Register a new model handler.""" _registry.frozen = False _registry.register(handler_class(registry=_registry)) _registry.frozen = True
deleted_lines: from keystone.models import revoke_model class _RevokeEventHandler(object): # NOTE(morganfainberg): There needs to be reserved "registry" entries set # in oslo_serialization for application-specific handlers. We picked 127 # here since it's waaaaaay far out before oslo_serialization will use it. identity = 127 handles = (revoke_model.RevokeEvent,) def __init__(self, registry): self._registry = registry def serialize(self, obj): return msgpackutils.dumps(obj.__dict__, registry=self._registry) def deserialize(self, data): revoke_event_data = msgpackutils.loads(data, registry=self._registry) revoke_event = revoke_model.RevokeEvent(**revoke_event_data) return revoke_event _registry.frozen = False _registry.register(_RevokeEventHandler(registry=_registry)) _registry.frozen = True

commit_message:
Keep only actually required attributes in cluster context

We do not have clear boundary between node and cluster attributes,
and we cannot use whole master node state as cluster state because
it contains the node specific attributes too. The temporary
solution is add only list of nodes and product version to cluster
attributes, because only this attributes are needed as old state for
nodes, that do not have previous state.

Change-Id: I12ac64048c47a1afea03dc07b4c8ba3ba2c3ce2e
Closes-Bug: 1582247

commit_message:
Reprioritize node statuses

* pending addition/pending deletion node states have bigger priority
  than node status and appropriate labels should be shown on a node panel
* pending addition/pending deletion states removed from node list
  sorting by node status

Closes-Bug: #1576590

Change-Id: I4efa6d9063a49a4c6737c21a27c141f24ee944fb

commit_message:
Disable directory listing in the Nginx

Due to security reasons, sensitive information shouldn't be exposed.
Whenever possible we should disable directory listing in the Nginx:
 * in the local repos we show an empty page for dirs without
   an index file.
 * in the dashboard site directory listing disabled completely.

Change-Id: If4fb2ae1361697beb484b832c9e52507a34381ab
Closes-Bug: #1584797
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit e3cee44a965e711823d95d5897193d1997359c8a)

commit_message:
Unified (one) error message for all invalid requests

It is possible based on the server error messages, to enumerate
directories and files on the application. This commit change the
default Nginx error messages to Unified one message with 200 (OK)
HTTP status code. For 404 (NOTFOUND) error we should preserve the
status code but provide the same Unified message because the
Package managers (in the Debian/Ubuntu at least) should know the
status of the file existence in the repos.

Change-Id: I6b996c5b1f8a1972379365571cf1f261e61b9ac5
Closes-Bug: #1585176
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit c2066a9f9b2b273cf1861fa8af4d0e46e6ea6865)

commit_message:
Prepare for ESLint and eslint-config-openstack upgrade

eslint-config-openstack has some extra rules which now need to be
respected. Also, ESLint 2 parses the code slightly differently,
so some brackets now must be wrapped in parens.

Change-Id: Ib0be57463236e7d757ddaff91aa571e8be65bbbc

commit_message:
Return 400 when task cannot be found

Do not fail with a 500 if users specify names of
tasks that don't exist.

Change-Id: Id88c4c361cda856185223b964cc08fa46ea5ee68

commit_message:
Fix text font-family of admonitions.

This prepends a div with the correct font-awesome classes,
and leaves the title (Info / Warning etc) to inhert
fonts from the rest of the document.

This also removes the need for the prepended space to the title.
(as the content of the div is a space).

Change-Id: I39b9c666534ccec4a0c801c30d01cf10e68bfba0

commit_message:
Lint YAML files

Currently most OpenStack code is linted, but YAML files are not. As a
result, sometimes YAML problems enter the code base (e.g., the key
duplicate fixed in change I7f2369adfb152fd2a74b9b105e969e653e592922).

This patch enables YAML linting in tox linting tests, using the
yamllint tool [1]. It checks syntax errors, key duplicates, and
cosmetic problems.

[1]: http://yamllint.readthedocs.org/

EDIT: It also fixes six errors (including key duplicates) that entered
the code base after the first fix change was merged.
(I7f2369adfb152fd2a74b9b105e969e653e592922)

Change-Id: Ie746230f28fe3ed0cf218201d5a3810f7bc44070

subject: xen: Allow custom libvirt kernel in PV mode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-06 09:58:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e55cefde1e30a8be27272b048425f8c73fb9d015', 'message': 'xen: Allow custom libvirt kernel in PV mode

Add a new configuration option under the "libvirt" section called
"xen_pv_kernel_path". If this option is set, the path is included
in the libvirt domain config under the <kernel> parameter.
Usually pygrub is used but pygrub doesn't support btrfs so
if a guest domain uses btrfs as filesystem, a different kernel needs
to be used. I.e. on a SUSE system the path to the kernel needed is
"/usr/lib/grub2/x86_64-xen/grub.xen".

Change-Id: I617c499457207c2795a664f087cbf525bbcccf04
Closes-Bug: #1531197
'}]
commit_message:
xen: Allow custom libvirt kernel in PV mode

Add a new configuration option under the "libvirt" section called
"xen_pv_kernel_path". If this option is set, the path is included
in the libvirt domain config under the <kernel> parameter.
Usually pygrub is used but pygrub doesn't support btrfs so
if a guest domain uses btrfs as filesystem, a different kernel needs
to be used. I.e. on a SUSE system the path to the kernel needed is
"/usr/lib/grub2/x86_64-xen/grub.xen".

Change-Id: I617c499457207c2795a664f087cbf525bbcccf04
Closes-Bug: #1531197

commit_message:
add experimental microversion selector

This adds experimental support for a microversion selector. The
interface for this may well change over time. To currently use this we
need 2 values in the sphinx conf.py to specify min and max
microversions. If you don't have those added, nothing is changed in
the UI.

Use at your own risk. However it's much easier to get feedback if we
have this in the package.

Change-Id: Iaf7e117ea5792bb3b60c1fd0ae416b241ab89d65

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-01 09:09:04.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/livemigrationops.py', 'hyperv/nova/pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_livemigrationops.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv/commit/7dcfd8c6a257ec54b97148ab87f0d7b966323761', 'message': "Fix live migration with shared storage

commit_message:
Fix live migration with shared storage

At the moment, when live migration is requested, we attempt to
copy the instance dvd disks and log files to the remote location,
other instance files being transparently copied by Hyper-V.

The issue is that we don't check whether shared storage is being
used, in which case this will fail.

This change adds this check.

Closes-Bug: #1565895

Change-Id: Ib646c90c830a1cd0e5401d14c6d400226b034f73
(cherry picked from commit ba2b0bbda58228e81c163c0b7cfef29cfaf13314)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/41/323741/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _test_live_migration(self, mock_copy_dvd_disks, mock_stop_console_handler, side_effect=None, shared_storage=False): mock_check_shared_storage = ( self._livemigrops._pathutils.check_remote_instances_dir_shared) mock_check_shared_storage.return_value = shared_storage mock_check_shared_storage.assert_called_once_with(fake_dest) if not shared_storage: mock_copy_logs.assert_called_once_with(mock_instance.name, fake_dest) mock_copy_dvd_disks.assert_called_once_with( mock_instance.name, fake_dest) else: self.assertFalse(mock_copy_logs.called) self.assertFalse(mock_copy_dvd_disks.called) self._test_live_migration() def test_live_migration_shared_storage(self): self._test_live_migration(shared_storage=True)

commit_message:
Creates instances_path in driver init_host method

In case the configured instance path does not exist, we create it
when the host is initialized.

commit_message:
Fixed detecting changes on new nodes

The cluster state will be used on new nodes as previous state
in case if the cluster already has successful deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1581002
Closes-Bug: 1573602

(cherry picked from commit eff4f2f5221515c098a02af8b73103d51e17decd)

commit_message:
Fixed detecting changes on new nodes

The cluster state will be used on new nodes as previous state
in case if the cluster already has successful deployment.

Closes-Bug: 1581002
Closes-Bug: 1573602
Change-Id: Ie8a81193dc6002d4d7dec56b3b73e186b835d5fc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/35/320335/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: task_data = self.old[task_id] except KeyError: return {} try: return task_data[node_id] except KeyError: # only if info for node does not present # use the default state return task_data.get(None) or {}

subject: Create planned VMs during LM only when needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-01 09:09:14.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/livemigrationops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_volumeops.py', 'hyperv/nova/volumeops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_livemigrationops.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv/commit/33408084ab2bbc4c50885ce79513b959ae5a40cd', 'message': 'Create planned VMs during LM only when needed

When performing a live migration, a planned VM is created every
time a volume is attached to the instance, while this is required
only in case of passthrough disks.

Skipping creating the planned VM when there are only disk files
attached takes out an unnecessary step, also dropping the Kerberos
constrained delegation requirement for environments where iSCSI/FC
based storage backends are not being used for Cinder.

Change-Id: Ib1aad4b5cf013b2ac62dc797ca6c53a2932f953f
(cherry picked from commit 56556f306d727b8402a5dd12bf35a7adcb9486ff)
'}]
commit_message:
Create planned VMs during LM only when needed

When performing a live migration, a planned VM is created every
time a volume is attached to the instance, while this is required
only in case of passthrough disks.

Skipping creating the planned VM when there are only disk files
attached takes out an unnecessary step, also dropping the Kerberos
constrained delegation requirement for environments where iSCSI/FC
based storage backends are not being used for Cinder.

Change-Id: Ib1aad4b5cf013b2ac62dc797ca6c53a2932f953f
(cherry picked from commit 56556f306d727b8402a5dd12bf35a7adcb9486ff)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/42/323742/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Make import_file do its own cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-14 15:56:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ace4c9c7db6c87f2fa9e77e0594897be618bd131', 'message': "Update import_file to provide a general-purpose interface

import_file is currently used only by the Rbd backend, and only for
importing a config file. The interface requires the caller to cleanup
after it, which means that code outside the Rbd driver is doing:

  if CONF.libvirt.images_type == 'rbd':
      os.unlink(configdrive_path)

This change turns import_file into a context manager. This allows us
to handle any required cleanup in the Rbd backend rather than pushing
it to the caller. We also add rudimentary locking, although note that
we don't yet add proper Rbd locking as there's no support for it in
our Rbd glue.

While this is a minimal change to the existing usage, the goal is to
have all imports use this interface. This will provide a place to
implement consistent atomic disk creation for all backends.

Change-Id: Ibc39fb2d5e3b7e1d5d1fc0386db2fe633e8897af
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-21 19:35:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2f94b80c1830ca2cf590ea95a6257ffdae700298', 'message': "Update import_file to provide a general-purpose interface

import_file is currently used only by the Rbd backend, and only for
importing a config file. The interface requires the caller to cleanup
after it, which means that code outside the Rbd driver is doing:

  if CONF.libvirt.images_type == 'rbd':
      os.unlink(configdrive_path)

This change turns import_file into a context manager. This allows us
to handle any required cleanup in the Rbd backend rather than pushing
it to the caller. We also add rudimentary locking, although note that
we don't yet add proper Rbd locking as there's no support for it in
our Rbd glue.

While this is a minimal change to the existing usage, the goal is to
have all imports use this interface. This will provide a place to
implement consistent atomic disk creation for all backends. With this
in mind, we also add import_file implementations for all backends.

Change-Id: Ibc39fb2d5e3b7e1d5d1fc0386db2fe633e8897af
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-08 13:59:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/89ec0f53e950267996568b4fabe98d5c2c576aca', 'message': "Update import_file to provide a general-purpose interface

commit_message:
Make import_file do its own cleanup

import_file is currently used only by the Rbd backend, and only for
importing a config file. The interface requires the caller to cleanup
after it, which means that code outside the Rbd driver is doing:

  if CONF.libvirt.images_type == 'rbd':
      os.unlink(configdrive_path)

This change turns import_file into a context manager, and implements
it for the only current users: NoBacking and Rbd. This allows us to
handle the required cleanup in the Rbd backend rather than pushing it
to the caller.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: Ibc39fb2d5e3b7e1d5d1fc0386db2fe633e8897af

commit_message:
Don't overwrite existing config file on resize/migrate

Resize and cold migrate were copying over an existing config disk,
converting it from raw to qcow2, then overwriting it with a new one.
Given that the original config disk is available and has already been
copied, we should just use that.

Closes-Bug: #1548884

Change-Id: I01dfd16a0f898b79e67dd98e989cb53a4bdd799f

commit_message:
Change checkers of config's applying order

Now for a node with multi-roles configs fot the same section
are merging by ID-priority. Thus last config for cinder will
be have higher priority and will rewrite compute config

Change-Id: Ic35a6c5efb05974dc7ab7ae36cc175a91471c778
Closes-Bug: #1587023

subject: Add check_backing_from_func interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-19 17:19:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5b5f13cabc38bfb5de6bd0f1546d150f3c7576dc', 'message': 'Add check_backing interface

Image.cache() currently implicitly does some backing file checks on an
existing disk. check_backing() performs the same function for disks
created by the output of a function (currently ephemeral and swap
disks), except it does it explicitly.

This function has a significant difference in behaviour, in that if
the file exists it will attempt to fetch it from the source rather
than generating a new one. If there is no source, for example when
calling from _hard_reboot, the backing file is irretrievably lost.
This is intuitively correct, as we have no way of generating identical
output ever again.

A following patch, which adds users of this function, makes an
important additional related change. With the following patch, we no
longer use backing files for ephemeral and swap disks. Therefore this
check is only for legacy instances.

Related-Bug: #1547577
Related-Bug: #1547582

Change-Id: I33b01038d1d1204a2871bd848594bafa1bfaf198

commit_message:
Add check_backing_from_func interface

Image.cache() currently implicitly does some backing file checks on an
existing disk. check_backing_from_func() performs the same function
for disks created by the output of a function (currently ephemeral and
swap disks), except it does it explicitly.

Note that the only backend which requires these checks is Qcow2, as no
other backend uses a backing file.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-instance-storage

Change-Id: I33b01038d1d1204a2871bd848594bafa1bfaf198
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/33/282433/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_backing(self, fallback_from_host): pass def check_backing(self, fallback_from_host): # Newly created generated disks no longer use the image cache, # so this check is purely for legacy disks. backing_path = libvirt_utils.get_disk_backing_file( self.path, imgmodel.FORMAT_QCOW2) if backing_path is None: return cache_pool = ImageCacheLocalPool.get() if not cache_pool.is_path_in_image_cache(backing_path): raise exception.InvalidDiskFormat( message=_LE('Qcow2 disk has backing file which is not in the ' 'image cache')) cache_name = os.path.basename(backing_path) cache_pool.ensure_cached(cache_name, fallback_from_host)

commit_message:
Adds Nova discoverable policy CLI spec

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/discoverable-policy-cli

Not all users have the same set of privileges. Not all API endpoints
are enabled. Because of this, adding an nova-manage CLI subcommand that
lists the operations an user is allowed to use can be helpful. This spec
describes phase one of a two phased implementation. The first phase
will prove out the idea using a raw representation that will be
improved in the second phase.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>

Implements: blueprint discoverable-policy-cli

Change-Id: I973f1e0545c73d66ef17bed77c6dda5de007cb1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/05/289405/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================ Nova discoverable policy API ============================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/discoverable-policy-api Not all users have the same set of priviledges. Not all API endpoints are enabled. Because of this, adding an API endpoint that lists the operations an user is allowed to use can be helpful. Problem description =================== Currently, users have no direct way of knowing which APIs they are allowed to use or which APIs are enabled by policy. This spec will add an API endpoint that will return a list of available APIs and operations usable by the user. Use Cases --------- Users will be able to use the new API to determine what operations are available to them and check if certain newer features are enabled / available (e.g.: live resize). Proposed change =============== The discoverable policy will be exposed through the ``os-policy`` API endpoint. For this, an API Controller will have to be created, as well as the python-novaclient implementation and tempest test for it. The API will return a list of operations currently available to the requesting user. It cannot be used to determine the list of available operations usable by other users. The returned operations will have to fulfill the following criteria: * The requesting user will pass the operation's policy rule. For example, if the policy states that the operation ``foo-bar`` is only usable by an admin, the operation will be returned only if the requesting user is an admin. * The API endpoint will have to be marked as discoverable. By default, all APIs are discoverable [1]. For example, having the following policy rule: ``os_compute_api:servers:discoverable": "is_admin:True`` means that the ``servers`` API and its operations is discoverable only by an admin and will not be returned to any other users. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The discoverable policy will be exposed through the ``os-policy`` API. The expected response codes are: * 200 OK, if the request succeeded. * 401 Unauthorized, if the user is not authorized to use the ``os-policy`` API. The data returned from the ``os-policy`` API will be as follows: `GET /os-policy/` Response body:: { "policy": { "operations": [ "os_compute_api:os-policy:index", "os_compute_api:os-quota-sets:show", ... ] } } Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignees: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com> Andrew Laski <andrew@lascii.com> Work Items ---------- * nova ``os-policy`` API implementation. * python-novaclient implementation. * tempest test for the new nova API. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit & functional tests. * Jenkins. Documentation Impact ==================== New API will have to be documented. References ========== [1] Default "discoverable" policies to "@" https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281911/1 History =======

commit_message:
Move version definition

Having openstack/__init__.py referencing pbr is causing some problems
sometimes when invoking sdk apis. This patch propose moving the version
definition into a module under openstack/.

Close-Bug: 1588823
Change-Id: I587de91ea7f523bb923ed9ac665a0b46d40d722c

commit_message:
Update docs for latest VMware interoperability

* Minimum vCenter version should be 5.1.0.
* The preferred command line is openstack not glance
* vmware_linked_clone is legacy in favor of img_linked_clone

Change-Id: Ib75355998d76e528a487fbcdc577662dd820179b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/65/324965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 5.1.0 and newer, runs VMware-based Linux and Windows images through a connection with a vCenter server.
deleted_lines: 4.1 update 1 and newer, runs VMware-based Linux and Windows images through a connection with a vCenter server or directly with an ESXi host.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-02 20:54:04.000000000', 'files': ['os_api_ref/assets/api-site.js'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-api-ref/commit/f2f0511d3ed9cacb5436055c8d6124ab657667b8', 'message': 'track the expanded elements in the url

commit_message:
track the expanded elements in the url

This tracks the expanded list via a dedicated parameter, which expand
all fills up. It uses the history api to ensure that urls that users
create are sharable, including all the sections expanded correctly.

Change-Id: I10d03226b15c9d4b880c42fb3c2ae0c05d8fb8ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-api-ref refs/changes/14/324814/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: // the list of expanded element ids var expanded = []; // whether we should sync expand changes with the location // url. We need to make this false during large scale // operations because we're using the history API, which is // expensive. So a bulk expand turns this off, expands // everything, turns it back on, then does a history sync. var should_sync = true; // Change the text on the expando buttons when // appropriate. This also add or removes them to the list of // expanded sections, and then syncs that list to the history // after such a change. var index = expanded.indexOf(this.id); if (index > -1) { expanded.splice(index, 1); } sync_expanded(); expanded.push(this.id); sync_expanded(); // Expand the world. Wires up the expand all button, it turns // off tye sync while it is running to save the costs with the // history API. $('#expand-all').click(function () { should_sync = false; } should_sync = true; sync_expanded(); }); // if there is an expanded parameter passed in a url, we run // through and expand all the appropriate things. if (window.location.search.substring(1).indexOf("expanded") > -1) { should_sync = false; var parts = window.location.search.substring(1).split('&'); for (var i = 0; i < parts.length; i++) { var keyval = parts[i].split('='); if (keyval[0] == "expanded" && keyval[1]) { var expanded_ids = keyval[1].split(','); for (var j = 0; j < expanded_ids.length; j++) { $('#' + expanded_ids[j]).collapse('show'); } } } should_sync = true; // This is needed because the hash *might* be inside a // collapsed section. // // NOTE(sdague): this doesn't quite seem to work while // we're changing the rest of the document. $(document.body).scrollTop($(window.location.hash).offset().top); // Take the expanded array and push it into history. Because // sphinx is building css appropriate ids, they should not have // any special characters we need to encode. So we can simply join // them into a comma separated list. function sync_expanded() { if (should_sync) { var url = UpdateQueryString('expanded', expanded.join(',')); history.pushState('', 'new expand', url); } } // Generically update the query string for a url. Credit to // http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5999118/add-or-update-query-string-parameter // for making this properly generic. function UpdateQueryString(key, value, url) { if (!url) url = window.location.href; var re = new RegExp("([?&])" + key + "=.*?(&|#|$)(.*)", "gi"), hash; if (re.test(url)) { if (typeof value !== 'undefined' && value !== null) return url.replace(re, '$1' + key + "=" + value + '$2$3'); else { hash = url.split('#'); url = hash[0].replace(re, '$1$3').replace(/(&|\?)$/, ''); if (typeof hash[1] !== 'undefined' && hash[1] !== null) url += '#' + hash[1]; return url; } } else { if (typeof value !== 'undefined' && value !== null) { var separator = url.indexOf('?') !== -1 ? '&' : '?'; hash = url.split('#'); url = hash[0] + separator + key + '=' + value; if (typeof hash[1] !== 'undefined' && hash[1] !== null) url += '#' + hash[1]; return url; } else return url; } }
deleted_lines: // Change the text on the expando buttons when appropriate // Expand the world $('#expand-all').click(function () { }}); // if ?expand_all is in the query string, then expand all // sections. This is useful for linking to nested elements, which // only work if that element is expanded. if (window.location.search.substring(1).indexOf("expand_all") > -1) { $('#expand-all').click();

commit_message:
Catch DriverLoadFailure for get_transport optional

new oslo.messaging 5.2.0 release will raise
oslo_messaging.transport.DriverLoadFailure if no existent transport
driver, hence breaks our code and unit test as well.

This patch fixes it by adding DriverLoadFailure to catch list.

Change-Id: I318d4b93beac9d1816fe4b5f9eb9de98e4debc04
Closes-Bug: #1588151
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/07/324207/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except (oslo_messaging.InvalidTransportURL, oslo_messaging.transport.DriverLoadFailure) as e: if not optional or getattr(e, 'url', None):
deleted_lines: except oslo_messaging.InvalidTransportURL as e: if not optional or e.url:

commit_message:
Hyper-V vTPM Devices

Windows / Hyper-V Server Technical Preview introduced the ability
to attach vTPM devices to the Hyper-V VMs, offering the users the
posibility to use it to enhance their security and system
integrity.

This commit implements adding vTPM devices to instances.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7728388415e3bef5f312a3630458b89bb1622694
Partially-Implements: blueprint hyper-v-vtpm-devices

commit_message:
extract the same output msg with a variable

the output format in filter are same, only need to
replace the result. we can extract it with a variable,
an avoid paste the code.

commit_message:
Take into account restriction's `strict` value

So far Nailgun always assumes that restrictions are strict, and doesn't
care about explicit (specified in restriction) `strict` value. This
commit fixes that, and if some restriction has an explicit `strict`
option it will be taken into account.

Change-Id: I5ef0e91f42cd708be5df56da461af4d7b568ae42
Closes-Bug: #1587773

Fix VENV temporary path

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-31 18:48:49.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/ceilometer.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/add_transport_url_parameters-29b87bdc9197a376.yaml', 'spec/classes/cinder_ceilometer_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/cinder_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder/commit/f8185bb497bcec6ab3ab0a39eb4f43b27f691cb3', 'message': 'Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging

This commit adds the transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging. The
url is of the form:

  transport://user:pass@host1:port[,hostN:portN]/virtual_host

Where the transport scheme specifies the rpc or notification backend
as one of rabbit, amqp, zmq, etc. Oslo.messaging is deprecating the
host, port, and auth configuration options [1]. All drivers will get
these options via the transport_url.

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::default resource
* use oslo::messaging::notifications resource
* add parameters for transport_url(s)
* update spec tests
* add feature release note

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: If5f30ba1944d897d2dd63539f4bb8a80e6c46c5e
'}]
commit_message:
Add transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging

This commit adds the transport_url parameters for oslo.messaging. The
url is of the form:

  transport://user:pass@host1:port[,hostN:portN]/virtual_host

Where the transport scheme specifies the rpc or notification backend
as one of rabbit, amqp, zmq, etc. Oslo.messaging is deprecating the
host, port, and auth configuration options [1]. All drivers will get
these options via the transport_url.

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::default resource
* use oslo::messaging::notifications resource
* add parameters for transport_url(s)
* update spec tests
* add feature release note

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/317285/

Change-Id: If5f30ba1944d897d2dd63539f4bb8a80e6c46c5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-cinder refs/changes/31/323531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_expected.to contain_cinder_config('DEFAULT/transport_url').with(:value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') describe 'with transport_url' do let :params do req_params.merge({ :default_transport_url => 'rabbit://rabbit_user:password@localhost:5673', }) end it { is_expected.to contain_cinder_config('DEFAULT/transport_url').with_value('rabbit://rabbit_user:password@localhost:5673') } end

   number of iterations.

commit_message:
Config settings to support PCI-DSS

Configuration settings to support PCI-DSS:
1. Disable users based on given minimum number of days of inactivity.
2. Lockout a user if number of failed attempts exceeds given limit.
3. Lockout user for a given amount of time if locked out.
4. Expire a password after given amount of days has passed
5. Require the user to create passwords that do not match the past given
   number of iterations.
6. Limit the number of times a password can be changed per day.
7. Require password complexity

Co-Authored-By: Ron De Rose ronald.de.rose@intel.com

Partially-Implements: blueprint pci-dss

Change-Id: I3ed5ca466ad15eab3c6e75aff3bb59543ecaabaa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/79/314679/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'compliance': [ cfg.BoolOpt('enable', default=False, help='enable the compliance settings'), cfg.IntOpt('lockout_days_no_activity', default=90, help='number of days for which a user can be inactive' 'before being locked out'), cfg.IntOpt('lockout_failure_attempts', default=6, help='number of times a user can fail login attempts until ' 'the user is locked out'), cfg.IntOpt('lockout_duration_mins', default=30, help='how long in minutes a user will be locked out for '), cfg.IntOpt('change_password_days', default=90, help='number of days for which a password will be ' 'considered valid before requiring the user to change' ' it'), cfg.IntOpt('cannot_match_last_password', default=4, help='number of latest password iterations for which the ' 'password must be unique'), cfg.IntOpt('password_change_limit_days', default=4, help='number of days for which a password will be ' 'considered valid before requiring the user to change' ' it'), cfg.StrOpt('password_regex', default="^(?=.*[A-Za-z])(?=.*\d)[A-Za-z\d]{7,}$", help='regex string to accept a valid password'), ]

(Defaults to 8786) # Setting this parameter overrides public_url, internal_url and admin_url parameters. # # [*public_protocol*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use public_url instead. # Protocol for public endpoint. (Defaults to 'http') # Setting this parameter overrides internal_url parameter. # # [*internal_address*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use internal_url instead. # Internal address for endpoint. (Defaults to '127.0.0.1') # Setting this parameter overrides internal_url parameter. # # [*admin_protocol*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use admin_url instead. # Protocol for admin endpoint. (Defaults to '127.0.0.1') # Setting this parameter overrides admin_url parameter. # # === Deprecation notes # # If any value is provided for public_protocol, public_address or port parameters, # public_url will be completely ignored. The same applies for internal and admin parameters. # # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $share_version = undef, $port = undef, $public_protocol = undef, $public_address = undef, $internal_protocol = undef, deprecated, use admin_url instead.') } if $public_address { warning('The public_address parameter is deprecated, use public_url instead.') } if $internal_address { warning('The internal_address $port or $share_version) { $public_url_real = sprintf('%s://%s:%s/%s/%%(tenant_id)s', pick($public_protocol, 'http'), pick($public_address, '127.0.0.1'), pick($port, '8786'), pick($share_version, 'v1')) } else { $public_url_real = $public_url } if ($admin_protocol or $admin_address or $port or $share_version) { $admin_url_real = sprintf('%s://%s:%s/%s/%%(tenant_id)s', pick($admin_protocol, 'http'), pick($admin_address, '127.0.0.1'), pick($port, '8786'), pick($share_version, 'v1')) } else { $admin_url_real = $admin_url } if ($internal_protocol or $internal_address or $port or $share_version) { $internal_url_real = sprintf('%s://%s:%s/%s/%%(tenant_id)s', pick($internal_protocol, 'http'), pick($internal_address, '127.0.0.1'), pick($port, '8786'), pick($share_version, 'v1')) } else { $internal_url_real = $internal_url } public_url => $public_url_real, admin_url => $admin_url_real, internal_url => $internal_url_real,

commit_message:
Reprioritize node statuses

* pending addition/pending deletion node states have bigger priority
  than node status and appropriate labels should be shown on a node panel
* pending addition/pending deletion states removed from node list
  sorting by node status

Closes-Bug: #1576590

Change-Id: I4efa6d9063a49a4c6737c21a27c141f24ee944fb

commit_message:
Update devstack configure in stable/mitaka branch

1.What is the problem:
The devstack configuration is still pointed to the master branch in
stable/mitaka branch

2.What needs to be fixed:
In the Tricircle stable/mitaka branch, the devstack configuration should
be changed to downlowd the code from the Tricircle stable/mitaka branch
but not from the master branch. And also use Mitaka Neutron release in
running devstack for version compatibility purpose but instead of the Neutron
master branch.

3.What is the purpose of this patch set:
The Tricircle stable/mitaka branch has no enough features to run the
Tricircle in production, but after this patch set is merged, we can make a
tag in this branch, and check whether the release publishing process works
or not. The release package publishing to PyPI job has been configured and
merged in the following patch set: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/323108/

Change-Id: Ic273eaa033dfb53fcd17e9e91945341bb9f88e58
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Update DevStack config

Change branch from master to stable/mitaka in DevStack config to ensure
the compatibitily between Tricircle and other projects.

Change-Id: I3fc6db54806c64a4a73929e0cc60b6bc9a625e7c
