commit_message:
Add support for Service Group v2.0 API to Tempest clients

The Service Group v2.0 API has new resource names in the Neutron API
service-groups, service-objects. Added various test cases to check the
API functionality
Implements: blueprint fwaas-customized-service for customized service
Authored-by: badveli vishnuvardhan <badveli_vishnuus@yahoo.com>

Change-Id: I23edcc29f635aea0db9c4069ad96c48aaf0647ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/09/113409/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2013 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import six from tempest.api.network import base from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.openstack.common import log as logging from tempest import test class ServiceGroupTest(base.BaseNetworkTest): _interface = 'json' LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) @test.requires_ext(extension='service-groups', service='network') def _create_service_group(self): # Create a service group name = data_utils.rand_name('servicegroup-') resp, group_create_body = self.client.create_service_group(name=name) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) self.assertEqual(group_create_body['service_group']['name'], name) return group_create_body, name @test.requires_ext(extension='service-groups', service='network') def _delete_service_group(self, servicegroup_id): resp, _ = self.client.delete_service_group(servicegroup_id) self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) # Asserting that the service group is not found in the list # after deletion resp, list_body = self.client.list_service_groups() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) servicegroup_list = list() for servicegroup in list_body['service_groups']: servicegroup_list.append(servicegroup['id']) self.assertNotIn(servicegroup_id, servicegroup_list) @test.requires_ext(extension='service-groups', service='network') def _delete_service_object(self, obj_id): resp, _ = self.client.delete_service_object(obj_id) self.assertEqual(204, resp.status) # Asserting that the service group is not found in the list # after deletion resp, obj_body = self.client.list_service_objects() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) obj_list = list() for sobj in obj_body['service_objects']: obj_list.append(sobj['id']) self.assertNotIn(obj_id, obj_list) @test.requires_ext(extension='service-groups', service='network') @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): super(ServiceGroupTest, cls).setUpClass() if not test.is_extension_enabled('fwaas', 'network'): msg = "service-group extension not enabled." raise cls.skipException(msg) @test.requires_ext(extension='service-groups', service='network') @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_list_update_show_delete_service_group(self): group_create_body, name = self._create_service_group() # List service groups and verify if created group is there in response resp, list_body = self.client.list_service_groups() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) servicegroup_list = list() for servicegroup in list_body['service_groups']: servicegroup_list.append(servicegroup['id']) self.assertIn(group_create_body['service_group']['id'], servicegroup_list) # Update the service group new_name = data_utils.rand_name('service-') new_description = data_utils.rand_name('service-description') resp, update_body = self.client.update_service_group( group_create_body['service_group']['id'], name=new_name, description=new_description) # Verify if service group is updated self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) self.assertEqual(update_body['service_group']['name'], new_name) self.assertEqual(update_body['service_group']['description'], new_description) # Show details of the updated service group resp, show_body = self.client.show_service_group( group_create_body['service_group']['id']) self.assertEqual(show_body['service_group']['name'], new_name) self.assertEqual(show_body['service_group']['description'], new_description) @test.requires_ext(extension='service-groups', service='network') @test.attr(type='smoke') def test_create_show_delete_service_object(self): group_create_body, _ = self._create_service_group() # Create objects for each protocol protocols = ['tcp', 'udp', 'icmp'] for protocol in protocols: name = "testserviceobj%s" % protocol resp, object_create_body = self.client.create_service_object( service_group_id=group_create_body['service_group']['id'], name=name, protocol=protocol ) self.assertEqual('201', resp['status']) # Show details of the created service object resp, show_object_body = self.client.show_service_object( object_create_body['service_object']['id'] ) self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) create_dict = object_create_body['service_object'] for key, value in six.iteritems(create_dict): self.assertEqual(value, show_object_body['service_object'][key], "%s does not match." % key) # List service objects and verify created object is in response resp, object_list_body = self.client.list_service_objects() self.assertEqual('200', resp['status']) obj_list = [sobj['id'] for sobj in object_list_body['service_objects']] self.assertIn(object_create_body['service_object']['id'], obj_list) commit_message:
Fail credential cases with explicit wrong config hint

Empty auth.tempest_roles will make some cases fail, this failure
is not easy to debug. This patch raises explicit hint for this kind
of failure.

Change-Id: I5a1ae8b2013905d6667aad36cf32926c5913f4c7
Closes-Bug: #1474193

commit_message:
Switch use of map() to a list comprehension

Because of a behavior change in the way map works on python3 we had
to explicitly cast each use of map() to a list to emulate the behavior
we expected in python2. However a list comprehension could be used
without doing list(map()) which is a slightly friendlier syntax. This
commit switches all the uses of map() with a wrapping list() to just
be a comprehension.

Change-Id: Id0a989c2b97d81473a380474c973ad380f2c825e

commit_message:
Make cleanup test accounts aware

Cleanup will only support test accounts moving forward, tenant isolation
and standard tempest and alternate tempest users and tenants are also
no longer supported by cleanup (typically these are named demo and
alt_demo). If CONF.auth.test_accounts_file is populated, cleanup will
handle these accounts in the same way the standard tempest and alternate
tempest users and tenants were handled in the past. If the test accounts
have not been configured or the test accounts file cannot be loaded,
cleanup will exit with an error.

When cleanup is run in standard mode objects left over by a tempest run
are deleted from the test account tenants but the test account tenants
and users themselves are NOT deleted so that tempest can be re-run easily.

If the --delete-tempest-test-accounts flag is set when running cleanup
the test accounts, tenants, networks, and routers will be deleted.

Lastly cleanup will no longer support tenant isolation.  If
allow_tenant_isolation is set to True in tempest.conf cleanup
will terminate.

Change-Id: I7f8f878bebec9fbdc6ab64a092780a0add3b1e4a

subject: Adds Telemetry compute metrics collection scenario
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-12-10 16:08:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/5e2a9cf082ef05da3a3d03fcfdbc3027fc3059ee', 'message': "Adds Telemetry compute metrics collection scenario

This test suite verifies that the instance metrics are properly published
and collected and have non-zero values. The verification is done via the
ceilometer API.

Waiting for the ceilometer compute agent to poll the resources is crucial,
otherwise the test suite will fail due to the fact that no samples would
be found published before checking the samples.

The ceilometer agent's polling interval should have the same value as
the test suite's metrics_polling_interval. This can be done in two ways:
a. Configure tempest's metrics_polling_interval, by adding the following
line in tempest.conf, in the telemetry section:
    metrics_polling_interval = <desired value>
b. Set the interval value in pipeline.yaml on the compute node to the
desired value and restart the ceilometer compute agent.

The second method is preferred, as the interval value defined in
pipeline.yaml is 600 seconds, which would mean each test would last
at least 10 minutes.

Change-Id: Icf41f119fb1393ea3508f12f2f065ecaea445b07
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-11 12:50:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9e1e2a7891f7f570257a19aa54ae81d314a2cc99', 'message': "Adds Telemetry compute metrics collection scenario

commit_message:
Adds Telemetry compute metrics collection scenario

This test suite verifies that the instance metrics are properly published
and collected and have non-zero values. The verification is done via the
ceilometer API.

Waiting for the ceilometer compute agent to poll the resources is crucial,
otherwise the test suite will fail due to the fact that no samples would
be found published before checking the samples.

The ceilometer agent's polling interval should have the same value as
the test suite's polled_metric_delay. This can be done in two ways:
a. Configure tempest's polled_metric_delay, by adding the following
line in tempest.conf, in the telemetry-feature-enabled section:
    polled_metric_delay = <desired value>
b. Set the interval value in pipeline.yaml on the compute node to the
desired value and restart the ceilometer compute agent.

The second method is preferred, as the interval value defined in
pipeline.yaml is 600 seconds, which would mean each test would last
at least 10 minutes.

Change-Id: Icf41f119fb1393ea3508f12f2f065ecaea445b07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/50/140750/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list_resources(self, query=None): resp, body = super(TelemetryClientJSON, self).list_resources(query) return body def list_samples(self, meter_id, query=None): resp, body = super(TelemetryClientJSON, self).list_samples(meter_id, query) return body

commit_message:
Added test for block-migration with shared storages for ephemerals

Checked that block migration for ephemerals, located
on shared storage is not available

commit_message:
test_in_tenant_no_securitygroup

This test case verifies in_tenant traffic dis-
associating instance port from security group,
also test validates updates port default security
group contains ingress rule then checks the
instance access.

Change-Id: Ie094ae226d4a21da97926a3fbe2807cf7937d22e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/93/158293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 11. _test_in_tenant_no_securitygroup: * test that in-tenant traffic is enabled after security goup is removed from instance port. def _remove_port_security_group(self, tenant, port_id): """ remove security group from a port """ port = self._update_security_group( port_id, security_groups=[], client=tenant.manager.network_client) return port @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_in_tenant_no_securitygroup(self): tenant_3 = self.primary_tenant name = 'server-{tenant}-no-sg'.format( tenant=tenant_3.creds.tenant_name) name = data_utils.rand_name(name) server = self._create_server(name, tenant_3) server_id = server['id'] port_id = self._list_ports(device_id=server_id)[0]['id'] ingress_rule = dict( direction='ingress', ) # add ingress rule to default security group self._create_security_group_rule( secgroup=tenant_3.security_groups['default'], client=tenant_3.manager.network_client, **ingress_rule) # check server connectivity ingress rule access_point_ssh = self._connect_to_access_point(tenant_3) self._check_connectivity(access_point=access_point_ssh, ip=self._get_server_ip(server), should_succeed=True) # remove security group from the instance port self._remove_port_security_group(tenant_3, port_id) access_point_ssh = self._connect_to_access_point(tenant_3) # check instance connectivity after removing security group self._check_connectivity(access_point=access_point_ssh, ip=self._get_server_ip(server), should_succeed=False) # update instance port with default security group self.network_client.update_port(port_id, security_groups=[ tenant_3.security_groups['default'].id]) # check instance access upon port updation self._check_connectivity(access_point=access_point_ssh, ip=self._get_server_ip(server), should_succeed=True)

Currently, a subnet description is a dictionary built with

commit_message:
Fix create subnet in scenario manager

Currently, a subnet description is a dictionary built with
some pre-defined keys and the kwargs parameter together. If any
of the pre-defined keys is present in kwargs, it will fail.
Moving to a two-step create/update solves the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1414702
Change-Id: Ic043a771b8f18d04e99a615123bfc0cf8c367996
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/92/151692/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
VPNaaS Scenario Test

Implementation of basic scenario test for VPNaaS. Sets up two
sites, creates a VPN tunnel between them, boots a server in each
site and asserts that the servers cannot ping each other before
the tunnel is created and can ping each other after the tunnel is
created.
The status attributes of the relevant service resources are also
verified to be ACTIVE after the tunnel is created.

This patch is based on Joris' initial vpnaas tempest patch[1],
Need this patch to test strongswan driver patch[2].
Many thanks to Joris.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/65515/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/144391/

Partially Implements: blueprint ipsec-strongswan-driver
Partially Implements: blueprint add-scenario-tests-in-icehouse

Change-Id: Ib1bd33ce87f8ba226f11c6f958a64850f78fa311
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/92/153292/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_keypair(self, client=None, name=None): if name is None: name = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__) tenant_network_cidr=None, if not tenant_network_cidr: tenant_network_cidr = netaddr.IPNetwork(CONF.network.tenant_network_cidr) tenant_cidr = netaddr.IPNetwork(tenant_network_cidr) def _create_vpnservice(self, client=None, subnet_id=None, router_id=None, namestart='vpn-test'): if not client: client = self.network_client name = data_utils.rand_name(namestart) result = client.create_vpnservice( subnet_id=subnet_id, router_id=router_id, admin_state_up=True, name=name) vpnservice = net_resources.DeletableVPNService(client=client, **result['vpnservice']) self.addCleanup(self.delete_wrapper, vpnservice.delete) return vpnservice def _get_router(self, client=None, tenant_id=None, namestart='router-smoke'): router = self._create_router(client, tenant_id, namestart=namestart)
deleted_lines: def create_keypair(self, client=None): name = data_utils.rand_name(self.__class__.__name__) tenant_cidr = netaddr.IPNetwork(CONF.network.tenant_network_cidr) def _get_router(self, client=None, tenant_id=None): router = self._create_router(client, tenant_id)

commit_message:
Improve nova CLI existing tests

Objective of this patch to parse the output of read only nova CLI's,
to validate the output and improve more output verification.
It is improving the code of all below read only nova CLI's subcommands:
1. absolute-limits
2. aggregate-list
3. availability-zone-list
4. cloudpipe-list
5. credentials
6. endpoints
7. flavor-list
8. floating-ip-bulk-list
9. floating-ip-list
10. floating-ip-pool-list
11. host-list
12. hypervisor-list
13. image-list
14. keypair-list
15. list
16. network-list
17. rate-limits
18. secgroup-list
19. server-group-list
20. service-list
21. usage
22. usage-list
23. volume-list
24. volume-snapshot-list
25. volume-type-list
26. help
27. list-extensions
28. net-list
29. agent-list
30. migration-list

Partially implements: blueprint cli-tests-coverage

Change-Id: I1754943fd4925ea41798008257f887c7240c6067
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/67/101767/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re absolute_limites = self.parser.listing(self.nova('absolute-limits')) self.assertTableStruct(absolute_limites, ['Name', 'Value']) aggregate_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('aggregate-list')) self.assertTableStruct(aggregate_list, ['Id', 'Name', 'Availability Zone']) zone_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('availability-zone-list')) self.assertTableStruct(zone_list, ['Name', 'Status']) cloudpipe_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('cloudpipe-list')) self.assertTableStruct(cloudpipe_list, ['Project Id', 'Public IP', 'Public Port', 'Internal IP']) credentials = self.parser.listing(self.nova('credentials')) self.assertTableStruct(credentials, ['User Credentials', 'Value']) endpoints = self.parser.listing(self.nova('endpoints')) self.assertTableStruct(endpoints, ['nova', 'Value']) flavor_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('flavor-list')) self.assertTableStruct(flavor_list, ['ID', 'Name', 'Memory_MB', 'Disk', 'Ephemeral', 'Swap', 'VCPUs', 'RXTX_Factor', 'Is_Public']) float_ip_bulk = self.parser.listing(self.nova('floating-ip-bulk-list')) self.assertTableStruct(float_ip_bulk, ['project_id', 'address', 'instance_uuid', 'pool', 'interface']) floating_ip_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('floating-ip-list')) self.assertTableStruct(floating_ip_list, ['Ip', 'Server Id', 'Fixed Ip', 'Pool']) float_ip_pool = self.parser.listing(self.nova('floating-ip-pool-list')) self.assertTableStruct(float_ip_pool, ['name']) host_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('host-list')) self.assertTableStruct(host_list, ['host_name', 'service', 'zone']) hypervisor_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('hypervisor-list')) self.assertTableStruct(hypervisor_list, ['ID', 'Hypervisor hostname']) image_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('image-list')) self.assertTableStruct(image_list, ['ID', 'Name', 'Status', 'Server']) self.parser.listing(self.nova('keypair-list')) rule = self.parser.listing(self.nova('list')) self.assertTableStruct(rule, ['ID', 'Name', 'Status', 'Task State', 'Power State', 'Networks']) network_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('network-list')) self.assertTableStruct(network_list, ['ID', 'Label', 'Cidr']) rate_limits = self.parser.listing(self.nova('rate-limits')) self.assertTableStruct(rate_limits, ['Verb', 'URI', 'Value', 'Remain', 'Unit', 'Next_Available']) secgroup_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('secgroup-list')) self.assertTableStruct(secgroup_list, ['Id', 'Name', 'Description']) server_group_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('server-group-list')) self.assertTableStruct(server_group_list, ['Id', 'Name', 'Policies', 'Members', 'Metadata']) servce_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('service-list')) self.assertTableStruct(servce_list, ['Id', 'Binary', 'Host', 'Zone', 'Status', 'State', 'Updated_at', 'Disabled Reason']) self.assertIn("Usage from", self.nova('usage')) usage_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('usage-list')) self.assertTableStruct(usage_list, ['Tenant ID', 'Servers', 'RAM MB-Hours', 'CPU Hours', 'Disk GB-Hours']) volume_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('volume-list')) self.assertTableStruct(volume_list, ['ID', 'Status', 'Display Name', 'Size', 'Volume Type', 'Attached to']) vol_snap_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('volume-snapshot-list')) self.assertTableStruct(vol_snap_list, ['ID', 'Volume ID', 'Status', 'Display Name', 'Size']) volume_type_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('volume-type-list')) self.assertTableStruct(volume_type_list, ['ID', 'Name']) help_text = self.nova('help') lines = help_text.split('\n') self.assertFirstLineStartsWith(lines, 'usage: nova') commands = [] cmds_start = lines.index('Positional arguments:') cmds_end = lines.index('Optional arguments:') command_pattern = re.compile('^ {4}([a-z0-9\-\_]+)') for line in lines[cmds_start:cmds_end]: match = command_pattern.match(line) if match: commands.append(match.group(1)) commands = set(commands) wanted_commands = set(('absolute-limits', 'list', 'help', 'net-list', 'service-list', 'hypervisor-list')) self.assertFalse(wanted_commands - commands) list_extensions = self.parser.listing(self.nova('list-extensions')) self.assertTableStruct(list_extensions, ['Name', 'Summary', 'Alias', 'Updated']) net_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('net-list')) self.assertTableStruct(net_list, ['ID', 'Label', 'CIDR']) agent_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('agent-list')) self.assertTableStruct(agent_list, ['Agent_id', 'Hypervisor', 'OS', 'Architecture', 'Version', 'Md5hash', 'Url']) migr_list = self.parser.listing(self.nova('migration-list')) self.assertTableStruct(migr_list, ['Source Node', 'Dest Node', 'Source Compute', 'Dest Compute', 'Dest Host', 'Status', 'Instance UUID', 'Old Flavor', 'New Flavor', 'Created At', 'Updated At']) version = self.nova('', flags='--version') self.assertTrue(re.search('^[0-9.]+', version))
deleted_lines: self.nova('absolute-limits') self.nova('aggregate-list') self.nova('cloudpipe-list') self.nova('credentials') self.nova('endpoints') self.assertIn("Memory_MB", self.nova('flavor-list')) self.nova('floating-ip-bulk-list') self.nova('floating-ip-list') self.nova('floating-ip-pool-list') self.nova('host-list') self.nova('hypervisor-list') self.nova('image-list') self.nova('keypair-list') self.nova('list') self.nova('network-list') self.nova('rate-limits') self.nova('secgroup-list') self.nova('server-group-list') self.nova('service-list') self.nova('usage') self.nova('usage-list') self.nova('volume-list') self.nova('volume-snapshot-list') self.nova('volume-type-list') self.nova('help') self.nova('list-extensions') self.nova('net-list') self.nova('agent-list') self.nova('migration-list') self.nova('', flags='--version')

commit_message:
Test-vm-create-with-udp-protocol

1.Create a new security-group-with tcp and udp protcol

2.Create a vm with security-group having udp protcol

3.Verify udp protocol with send message fucntion

Change-Id: I819e26c6ebb7389676e984eb0f28d4a528593f13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/87/157287/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import random def _send_msg(self, source_ip, dest_ip, listen_ip, protocol, keypair): """ Send messsage from server #1 to server #2 using 'nc' command """ private_key = keypair port = random.randint(4500, 5500) source_port = port dest_port = port msg = 'Hello there!' # It is going to send message from floating ip of ... # ... server #2 to floating ip of server #1 ssh_source = self._ssh_to_server(source_ip, private_key) ssh_dest = self._ssh_to_server(dest_ip, private_key) # The server #2 listens on fixed ip nc = 'sudo nc %s' % ('-u' if protocol == 'udp' else '') # Run listener ssh_dest.exec_command('kill -9 `pidof "nc"` || true') ssh_dest.exec_command('%s -l -p %s -s %s > out.log &' % (nc, dest_port, listen_ip)) # Send message ssh_source.exec_command('echo -n "%s" | %s -w1 -p %s %s %s || true' % (msg, nc, source_port, dest_ip, dest_port)) # Read received message received = ssh_dest.exec_command("cat out.log; rm out.log") return received == msg @test.attr(type='smoke') @test.services('compute', 'network') def test_create_security_group_rule_with_udp_protocol(self): """ This test verifies the vm with udp protocol """ udp_tenant = self.primary_tenant protocol = 'udp' rulesets = [ dict( # all tcp protocol='tcp', port_range_min=1, port_range_max=65535, ), dict( # all udp protocol='udp', port_range_min=1, port_range_max=65535, ), ] for ruleset in rulesets: for r_direction in ['ingress', 'egress']: ruleset['direction'] = r_direction self._create_security_group_rule( secgroup=udp_tenant.security_groups['default'], **ruleset) # Create server with default security group name = 'server-{tenant}-gen-1-'.format( tenant=udp_tenant.creds.tenant_name ) secgroups = udp_tenant.security_groups.values() server = self._create_server(name, udp_tenant, security_groups=secgroups) self._assign_floating_ips(udp_tenant, server) keypair = udp_tenant.keypair['private_key'] try: access_point_ssh = self._connect_to_access_point(udp_tenant) listen_ip = self._get_server_ip(server) server_id = server['id'] dest_ip = self.floating_ips[server_id].floating_ip_address source_ip = \ self.floating_ips[ udp_tenant.access_point['id']].floating_ip_address self.assertTrue(self._send_msg( source_ip, dest_ip, listen_ip, protocol, keypair)) except Exception: for tenant in self.tenants.values(): self._log_console_output(servers=tenant.servers) raise

commit_message:
Minimal NUMA support test

The test validates the minimal configuration for NUMA that every host
should be able to provide.
The results show that one will succeed to boot an instance in a single
NUMA Cell.

Change-Id: Ic35555e5fbdaf12cebed8abf5f2b5fb7aa3cc02a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/40/143540/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type='gate') def test_create_server_with_simple_numa(self): def flavor_clean_up(flavor_id): resp, body = self.flavor_client.delete_flavor(flavor_id) self.assertEqual(resp.status, 202) self.flavor_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(flavor_id) ram = 1 vcpus = 1 disk = 0 numa_spec = {'hw:numa_nodes': '1', 'hw:numa_cpus.0': '0', 'hw:numa_mem.0': '1'} admin_pass = self.image_ssh_password # Create a flavor with extra specs rand_flavor_name = data_utils.rand_name('my_numa_flavor') rand_flavor_id = data_utils.rand_int_id(start=1000) resp, flavor = (self.flavor_client. create_flavor(rand_flavor_name, ram, vcpus, disk, rand_flavor_id)) self.addCleanup(flavor_clean_up, flavor['id']) self.flavor_client.set_flavor_extra_spec(flavor['id'], numa_spec) resp, server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE', adminPass=admin_pass, flavor=flavor['id']) self.assertEqual(202, resp.status)

commit_message:
Negative unrealistic NUMA test

The test requests a high number of numa cells, that the gate should
not be able to satisfy.
It validates that numa settings in extra_specs are being considered
and makes sure that the request will fail with a relevant exception.
Adding a configuration option to control the number of NUMA cells,
in order to present an unrealistic number.

Change-Id: Ic14a6e9ff53292cb27ac19e01a50dda5a8aa2379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/41/143541/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import exceptions @test.attr(type=['negative', 'gate']) def test_create_server_with_unrealistic_numa(self): def flavor_clean_up(flavor_id): resp, body = self.flavor_client.delete_flavor(flavor_id) self.assertEqual(resp.status, 202) self.flavor_client.wait_for_resource_deletion(flavor_id) ram = 1 vcpus = 16 disk = 0 numa_spec = {'hw:numa_nodes': '16', 'hw:numa_cpus.0': '0', 'hw:numa_mem.0': '1', 'hw:numa_cpus.1': '1', 'hw:numa_mem.1': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.2': '2', 'hw:numa_mem.2': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.3': '3', 'hw:numa_mem.3': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.4': '4', 'hw:numa_mem.4': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.5': '5', 'hw:numa_mem.5': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.6': '6', 'hw:numa_mem.6': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.7': '7', 'hw:numa_mem.7': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.8': '8', 'hw:numa_mem.8': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.9': '9', 'hw:numa_mem.9': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.10': '10', 'hw:numa_mem.10': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.11': '11', 'hw:numa_mem.11': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.12': '12', 'hw:numa_mem.12': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.13': '13', 'hw:numa_mem.13': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.14': '14', 'hw:numa_mem.14': '0', 'hw:numa_cpus.15': '15', 'hw:numa_mem.15': '0'} admin_pass = self.image_ssh_password # Create a flavor with extra specs rand_flavor_name = data_utils.rand_name('my_numa_flavor') rand_flavor_id = data_utils.rand_int_id(start=1000) resp, flavor = (self.flavor_client. create_flavor(rand_flavor_name, ram, vcpus, disk, rand_flavor_id)) self.addCleanup(flavor_clean_up, flavor['id']) self.flavor_client.set_flavor_extra_spec(flavor['id'], numa_spec) self.assertRaises(exceptions.BuildErrorException, self.create_test_server, wait_until='ERROR', adminPass=admin_pass, flavor=flavor['id'])
